name: Skin Anatomy
description: The skin is the largest organ of the body, with a total area of about 20 square feet. It weighs 9 lbs and contains more than 11 miles of blood vessels.
The skin protects us from microbes and the elements, helps regulate body temperature, and permits the sensations of touch, heat, and cold.
Your skin has at least five different types of receptors that respond to pain and touch.
